semaphore

Class Semaphore

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.concurrent.Semaphore
      • semaphore.LocalSemaphore
        • semaphore.Semaphore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, SemaphoreInterface

    public class Semaphore
extends LocalSemaphore
    A local Semaphore class. For the exercises using Java's Semaphore class leave this class as a subclass of java.util.concurrent.Semaphore. To test your implementation of unbounded semaphores call your unbounded semaphore class e.g. UnboundedSemaphore and then change this class to be a subclass of your unbounded semaphore class (i.e. Semaphore extends UnboundedSemaphore). Similarly for the three implementations of bounded semaphore. To test each of them simply change this class to be a subclass of the relevant bounded semaphore class and then run the buffer system. Similarly for the three types of bounded semaphore. You will then also need to edit this code to use the constructor that calls the constructor of the superclass with two parameters.
    Version:
    January 2020
    Author:
    Hugh Osborne
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Semaphore

        public Semaphore(java.lang.String name,
                 int initialValue,
                 int limit)
        A generic constructor, with a limit value for bounded semaphores. For unbounded semaphores, such as this one, the limit parameter is ignored.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of this semaphore
        initialValue - the initial value for this semaphore
        limit - limit value for the semaphore

      • Semaphore

        public Semaphore(java.lang.String name,
                 int initialValue)
        A semaphore with no (explict) upper limit.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of this semaphore
        initialValue - the initial value for this semaphore
